answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Itchiness of the whole body could be due to extreme dryness of the skin. The other causes for the itchiness could be scabies, diabetes mellitus, eczema, tinea pedis (fungal infection) and psoriasis. Others could be due to skin conditions like contact dermatitis Any lymph node if it is persistently enlarged, may need to be biopsied. Please discuss this with your doctor am sure he will provide further assistance.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: My doctor took my off my contraceptive, saying i'm too old for it(51). Since then I struggle with my health.  In July I started itching after taking part in a winter walk(8km).  My face felt extremely hot, my eyes swelled up, and my face itched terribly.  A few days later I went for a routine mammogram and asked the dr to check my face with his sonar.  All my glands were swollen, and an echo structure on my thyroid.  He said it was nothing, told me to take antihistamines.  Few days later I was so sick I went to a homeopath.  He said it was glandular fever and mumps.  It has now been 2 months and my glands all went down except for one on one side under my ear, although it is still uncomfortable when I turn my head from side to side.  The itch has gotten so bad to the point that I want to scrape my skin off with a knife!  In the first month it was only on my face, then spread to my arms, and a few days ago spread to my legs. If I bend over, feels like all the blood is going to my head.  Blood pressure is normal.  Today it feels like my eyes are swelling again and they are a bit red around the edges.  Lymphoma has come to mind, but is it possible that I only have an allergy to something?  Other than that I feel fine, still have all my energy. Can it be hormonal?  I don't want to use hormone replacement, read too many negative things about it, and I don't have menopausal symptoms.  Please help.
title: uncontrolable itch with swollen lymph nodes
